title: Holland vs The Netherlands: What's The Difference? - Brilliant Maps
text: The map above shows the difference pretty clearly: The Netherlands is the official name of the country located in North-western Europe. It consists of 12 provinces, each with its own local government and unique characteristics. Holland, on the other hand, refers specifically to two provinces within the Netherlands: North Holland (Noord-Holland) and South Holland (Zuid-Holland). Historically, these two provinces were the most economically and politically significant regions, especially during the Dutch Golden Age (17th century), which led to the name “Holland” often being used to refer to the entire country. However, using “Holland” to mean the whole country is technically incorrect and can be misleading, as it excludes the other ten provinces. Population Figures: - Netherlands Total Population: Approximately 18 million people (as of 2023). - North Holland Population: Around 3.0 million. (Capital: Haarlem) - South Holland Population: About 3.8 million. (Capital: The Hague) These two provinces alone account for a significant portion of the country’s population due to the presence of major cities and economic centers. Biggest Cities in the Netherlands: - Amsterdam - Province: North Holland - Population: Approximately 872,000 - Highlights: Capital city of the Netherlands (but confusingly not its seat of government), renowned for its artistic heritage, elaborate canal system, historic architecture, and vibrant cultural scene. - Rotterdam - Province: South Holland - Population: Around 651,000 - Highlights: Known for having one of the world’s largest ports, modern architecture, and a dynamic urban atmosphere. - The Hague (Den Haag) - Province: South Holland - Population: Approximately 545,000 - Highlights: Seat of the Dutch government and parliament, also the capital of South Holland, home to the International Court of Justice, and known for its seaside location. - Utrecht - Province: Utrecht - Population: Around 357,000 - Highlights: Central city with a medieval old town, iconic Dom Tower, and a significant student population. - Eindhoven - Province: North Brabant - Population: Approximately 235,000 - Highlights: Known as a technology and design hub, associated with the electronics company Philips and innovative industries. Summary: - The term “Netherlands” encompasses the entire country with all its 12 provinces. - “Holland” specifically refers to the two provinces of North Holland and South Holland. - The confusion arises from historical prominence, but using “Holland” to describe the whole country overlooks the diversity of the other provinces. - Major cities like Amsterdam and Rotterdam are located within Holland, contributing to its prominence.
